Class Summary
AI class AI tries to think of good moves.

Board  
BoardPict The playing board has 4 quadrants (upper/lower, left/right) with the bar standing vertically between them.

Caution Degree of Cautiousness
Communication  
ConnectThread This thread connects to a specified computer
Dice So that we can work with theoretical rolls (if we get roll X then ...) There are 2 dice but how about when we roll doubles we think of them as being 4 dice? Or merely use a partialMovesCountDown? Stored in here? There's a parallel array in here marking which dice have been used so far.
DiceTest The test class DiceTest.
FixedButton  
Game  
GameTest The test class GameTest.
GUI_Dim The GUI basically has a column of buttons that should be done in a JPane
HitBlot For keeping track of which blots were hit during the course of a move.
JBackgammonApplet  
LocList Holds ArrayList, useful for saying "here are all the points that have moveable blots" Has no privacy, is just for convenience (for testing routines) Might want to have info about how many are on each of those points, someday.
MainMenuListener  
MathDemo The test class MathDemo.
Move Immutable! Holds a "move", which includes 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 partialMoves.
MoveTest The test class MoveTest.
MoveWithScore For returning scored moves from Board.bestMove(Scorer s, Player p) since I'm hesitant to complicate Move with an additional score field.
MyMouseListener  
PartialMove Immutable! (Only has constructor and private fields and getters.) Holds a "single" part of a move.
PartialMoveTest The test class PartialMoveTest.
Player To keep track of "white" and "black" (and perhaps more colors someday) Might want to be singletons someday?
PlayerTest The test class PlayerTest.
PointBuildOddsScorer More sophisticated than PointBuildScorer in also worrying about the existing odds that an unprotected point can actually be hit.

RiskAverseStrategy RiskAverse Strategy - Tries to protect points and not risk getting knocked to bar.
Scorer Abstract class Scorer - so various AIs can score boards differently
ShowPartialMoveButton  
ShowPartialMoveLabel  
SocketListener Once a connection is established, this thread listens for packets
StartGameStrategy StartGameStrategy is hard-wired with "best" start moves (source: "Mathematics of Games & Gambling" chapter "Backgammon and other dice Diversions" pg.29) Best early moves, if possible.
StartGameTest The test class StartGameTest.
Status Public Class - Status Status is for keeping track of various variables throughout the program and “keeping the state of the game nice and clean.”
Strategy  
 

Exception Summary
BackgammonException Superclass for my exceptions so I can catch them in one grab.
BadBoardException BadBoardException for squawking about wrong number of pieces on board.
BadMoveException BadBoardException for squawking about wrong number of partialMoves in a Move, etc.
BadPartialMoveException BadPartialMoveException for squawking about negative moves or bad start or end points.
